sanskrit: पश्यैतां पाण्डुपुत्राणामाचार्य महतीं चमूम्| व्यूढां द्रुपदपुत्रेण तव शिष्येण धीमता  || 1.3 ||
Translation: Behold, O Teacher! This mighty army of the sons of Pandu, arrayed by the son of Drupada, thy wise disciple.
answer: Duryodhana says to his teacher Drona, 'Behold, O Teacher! This mighty army of the sons of Pandu, arrayed by the son of Drupada, thy wise disciple.' He is expressing his awe at the strength of the Pandava army and is interested in knowing more about their assembled forces. Duryodhana inquires about the ability of the Pandavas and their army, and thereafter, a detailed conversation between them follows, focusing on understanding the might of the Pandavas.
